definitions.definition: A pinniped (Pinnipedia), particularly an earless seal (true seal) or eared seal.
definitions.example: The seals in the harbor looked better than they smelled.

definitions.definition: A bearing representing a creature something like a walrus.
To hunt seals.
definitions.example: They're organizing a protest against sealing.

definitions.definition: A stamp used to impress a design on a soft substance such as wax.
An impression of such stamp on wax, paper or other material used for sealing.
A design or insignia usually associated with an organization or an official role.
definitions.example: The front of the podium bore the presidential seal.

definitions.definition: Anything that secures or authenticates.
Something which will be visibly damaged if a covering or container is opened, and which may or may not bear an official design.
definitions.example: The result was declared invalid, as the seal on the meter had been broken.

definitions.definition: Confirmation or approval, or an indication of this.
definitions.example: Her clothes always had her mom's seal of approval.

definitions.definition: Something designed to prevent liquids or gases from leaking through a joint.
definitions.example: The canister is leaking. I think the main seal needs to be replaced.

definitions.definition: A tight closure, secure against leakage.
definitions.example: Close the lid tightly to get a good seal.

definitions.definition: A chakra.
To place a seal on (a document).
To mark with a stamp, as an evidence of standard exactness, legal size, or merchantable quality.
To fasten (something) so that it cannot be opened without visible damage.
definitions.example: The cover is sealed. If anyone tries to open it, we'll know about it.

definitions.definition: To prevent people or vehicles from crossing (something).
definitions.example: The border has been sealed until the fugitives are found.

definitions.definition: To close securely to prevent leakage.
definitions.example: I've sealed the bottle to keep the contents fresh.

definitions.definition: To place in a sealed container.
definitions.example: I've sealed the documents in this envelope.

definitions.definition: To place a notation of one's next move in a sealed envelope to be opened after an adjournment.
definitions.example: After thinking for half an hour, the champion sealed his move.

definitions.definition: To guarantee.
definitions.example: The last-minute goal sealed United’s win.

definitions.definition: To fix, as a piece of iron in a wall, with cement or plaster, etc.
To close by means of a seal.
definitions.example: to seal a drainpipe with water

definitions.definition: To confirm or set apart as a second or additional wife.
To tie up animals (especially cattle) in their stalls.
